summaryText: Wow, what an incredible message from Pastor Manny Arango about resilience, faith, and believing again after failure! Pastor Manny shared his deeply personal journey of struggling with infertility, experiencing a devastating miscarriage, and ultimately receiving a miracle child through perseverance and faith. Drawing from the biblical story of Peter walking on water, he powerfully illustrated that faith isn't just about initial courage, but about having the strength to get back up after sinking. Sometimes life throws us unexpected challenges that can make us want to retreat, but Pastor Manny reminds us that God is calling us to 'have faith again' - to trust, hope, and step out even after experiencing pain. His own testimony of going through IVF twice, losing a pregnancy during the pandemic, and ultimately receiving a miracle son is a testament to God's faithfulness. The most powerful moment? When he described his wife's perspective of being grateful for the nine weeks of pregnancy, showing that our attitude can transform our experience of setbacks. Pastor Manny's message isn't just about miraculous moments, but about the courage to believe and trust God's plan, even when it doesn't look like what we expected.
mainPoints: God calls us to have faith even after experiencing failure
Failure doesn't define you, but how you respond to it does
Miracles require preparation and persistent faith

versesMentioned.text: Immediately Jesus made the disciples get into the boat and go on ahead of him to the other side, while he dismissed the crowd. After he had dismissed them, he went up on a mountainside by himself to pray. Later that night, he was there alone, and the boat was already a considerable distance from land, buffeted by the waves because the wind was against it. Shortly before dawn Jesus went out to them, walking on the lake. When the disciples saw him walking on the lake, they were terrified. 'It's a ghost,' they said, and cried out in fear. But Jesus immediately said to them: 'Take courage! It is I. Don't be afraid.' 'Lord, if it's you,' Peter replied, 'tell me to come to you on the water.' 'Come,' he said. Then Peter got down out of the boat, walked on the water and came toward Jesus. But when he saw the wind, he was afraid and, beginning to sink, cried out, 'Lord, save me!' Immediately Jesus reached out his hand and caught him. 'You of little faith,' he said, 'why did you doubt?'

Monday.scripture: Hebrews 11:1: 'Now faith is confidence in what we hope for and assurance about what we do not see.'
Monday.focus: Understanding that faith requires trusting beyond what is visible
Monday.action: Reflect on an area of your life where you've given up hope. Write down what it would look like to approach this situation with renewed faith and hope.
Monday.prayer: Lord, renew my faith today. Help me to trust You even when I cannot see the way forward. Give me the courage to believe again.

Tuesday.scripture: James 1:2-4: 'Consider it pure joy, my brothers and sisters, whenever you face trials of many kinds, because you know that the testing of your faith produces perseverance.'
Tuesday.focus: Viewing challenges as opportunities for spiritual growth
Tuesday.action: Identify a past challenge that you initially saw as a setback. Journal about how that experience actually helped you grow stronger in your faith.
Tuesday.prayer: God, help me see my challenges through Your perspective. Transform my pain into purpose and my struggles into strength.

Wednesday.scripture: Philippians 3:13-14: 'Brothers and sisters, I do not consider myself yet to have taken hold of it. But one thing I do: Forgetting what is behind and straining toward what is ahead, I press on toward the goal to win the prize for which God has called me heavenward in Christ Jesus.'
Wednesday.focus: Learning to move forward after disappointment
Wednesday.action: Make a list of past disappointments. Next to each one, write a positive lesson or growth that came from that experience. Symbolically release these to God.
Wednesday.prayer: Father, help me not be defined by my past failures. Give me the courage to press forward and trust in Your plan for my life.

Thursday.scripture: Isaiah 43:18-19: 'Forget the former things; do not dwell on the past. See, I am doing a new thing! Now it springs up; do you not perceive it?'
Thursday.focus: Embracing new opportunities and God's fresh work in our lives
Thursday.action: Identify one area where you've been stuck or afraid to try again. Take a small, tangible step towards reopening that possibility.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, open my eyes to the new things You are doing. Give me courage to step out in faith, even when I'm afraid.

Friday.scripture: Psalm 34:18: 'The Lord is close to the brokenhearted and saves those who are crushed in spirit.'
Friday.focus: Understanding God's nearness during difficult times
Friday.action: Reach out to someone you know who is struggling and offer genuine encouragement and support.
Friday.prayer: God, comfort those who are hurting. Use me as an instrument of Your hope and healing.

Saturday.scripture: Romans 8:28: 'And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose.'
Saturday.focus: Trusting God's sovereign plan even when we don't understand
Saturday.action: Spend time in quiet reflection, asking God to reveal areas where you need to surrender and trust His plan more fully.
Saturday.prayer: Heavenly Father, I trust You. Help me to believe that You are working all things together for my good, even when I cannot see the full picture.
